result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harassment-Fear of Death/Injunction, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.013(1r).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete a Mental Health Evaluation and comply with all recommendations.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.
Must maintain full time employment.

No contact with KLO. Not to be at or near KLO's residence. 

Not to be in the parking lot of Alibi Bar, Amery WI.

Absolute sobriety. 

Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. 

Not to possess or consume alcohol.

Must complete any programming required by agent. 

Maintain complete compliance with terms of Injunction in 22CV272. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Brown

records.addlTxt: DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form
KO - Exhibit 1

CASES: 22CF183 & 22CV272. 1:33 PM Defendant Mark A Brown in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Mark A Brown.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Wood Webster recites agreement. Stipulation to agreement for TRO. Petition has just been filed by victim and counsel stipulates to entry of INJ as part of agreement in this case. Amended info has been filed. CT questions def. On amended count 1- def- NC plea. On ct 2- def- G plea. Count 3- G plea. CT accepts pleas, adj G.  

22CV272 called. Petition for TRO has just been filed as part of agreement in CF file. Copy of petition recv'd by respondent Mark Brown. CT questions Mark Brown. Mark agreeing to entry of INJ. Atty Taber indicates resp does not have firearms. CT enters INJ by stipulation for 4 years until 10/10/26. CT reviews INJ terms. Mark Brown personally served with copy of INJ in court. 

22CF183: Statement of victim read to court by victim coordinator. Exh 1 recv'd. ADA- argument. Atty Taber- argument. 

SENTENCE:
W/held 2 years probation on each count. No contact with KLO. Not to be in the parking lot of Alibi Bar, Amery WI. No to be at or near KLO's residence. Mental health evaluation and comply. AODA and comply. Maintain full time job. AS. No drugs without a prescription. No alcohol. $265.60 fine/costs on each count. $200 DNA surcharge on each count. DNA sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Must report to probation today. Any programming required by agent. Maintain complete compliance with terms of INJ in 22CV272. 0 days credit. 2:09 pm adj.
filed by atty Taber

9:22 AM Defendant Mark A Brown in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Mark A Brown.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Resolved. Bond cont. 9:26 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:11 AM Defendant Mark A Brown in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Mark A Brown.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk Atty Taber states matter is not quite resolved. State has made response. CT. set status. Bond cont. 10:14 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status hearing on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Mark A Brown in court.   Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Mark A Brown. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. AW-clerk.  Atty Taber waive reading and enter NG plea.  CT-accepts plea.  Atty Taber preserved for 15 days on prearrangement rights.  Bond cont.  9:20 am adj
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
1- Police Report

11:02 AM Defendant Mark A Brown in court.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Mark A Brown. AW-clerk   State calls Officer Pete Krumrie S&T.  ID made.  Atty Taber cross. State redirect.  Exhibit 1 O&R, Police report. (Sealed to public).    Atty Taber redirect.  Parties rests.  CT-establishes that the identification of the person on report are incorrect.  However the narrative in the report is correct to the DE that is in the courtroom.  Witness released.  Atty Taber addresses the court.  State addresses the court.  CT-addresses parties.  CT-finds ID made, venue established.  CT-finds PC, DE is bound over.  State to file information.  Bond conts.  11:41 am adj
Arraignment scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Arraignment on July 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Renee Taber on behalf of Defendant

records.addlTxt: DENIED - Order Appointing Counsel (Defendant did not contact PD for representation) *Mailed copy of Defendant 5/26 w/ PD phone number

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact with KLO. Not to be inside the Alibi bar or loiter outside of the entry of the Alibi bar.

2:29 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Mark A Brown in court.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Mark A Brown, appearing specially for today's purposes. Reading waived. CT sets bond. WSPH. Def states he does not qualify, has completed application for court appointed counse. Atty Firkus will not be able to take the case due to a conflict. 2:33 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
